content: To prove the equality of two complex numbers, "ext" used to work until I updated my Mathlib. Why is that? I'm aware that "apply Complex.ext" does the same job, but is there a better way?
It turns out that usually that's not the easiest way to prove equality of complex numbers, so we removed it from the lemmas that the ext tactic tries
I see, thank you. Could you please give me an example of an easier way to prove equality of complex numbers?
local attribute [ext] Complex.ext is another way to make your old proof work
Depends on the situation, I guess. In a very simple case where you need to prove a + b = b + a, you'd use add_comm directly rather than checking that (a + b).re = (b + a).re etc

That's great. Thanks
